intro: Vernonia neocorymbosa, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet, with grey-green foliage and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Vernonia neocorymbosa plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
